intro: Scleranthus jankei, commonly known as the Janke's thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scleranthus jankei is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh climates and its potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
